    • Method Detail

      • createJob

        public boolean createJob​(java.lang.String slurmScript,
                         java.lang.String heronExec,
                         java.lang.String[] commandArgs,
                         java.lang.String topologyWorkingDirectory,
                         long containers,
                         java.lang.String partition)
        Create a slurm job. Use the slurm scheduler's sbatch command to submit the job. sbatch allocates the nodes and runs the script specified by slurmScript. This script runs the heron executor on each of the nodes allocated.
        Parameters:
        slurmScript - slurm bash script to execute
        heronExec - the heron executable
        commandArgs - arguments to the heron executor
        topologyWorkingDirectory - working directory
        containers - number of containers required to run the topology
        partition - the queue to submit the job
        Returns:
        true if the job creation is successful

      • createJob

        public boolean createJob​(java.lang.String slurmScript,
                         java.lang.String heronExec,
                         java.lang.String[] commandArgs,
                         java.lang.String topologyWorkingDirectory,
                         long containers)
        Create a slurm job. Use the slurm schedule'r sbatch command to submit the job. sbatch allocates the nodes and runs the script specified by slurmScript. This script runs the heron executor on each of the nodes allocated.
        Parameters:
        slurmScript - slurm bash script to execute
        heronExec - the heron executable
        commandArgs - arguments to the heron executor
        topologyWorkingDirectory - working directory
        containers - number of containers required to run the topology
        Returns:
        true if the job creation is successful

                             java.lang.String[] slurmCmd,
                             java.lang.StringBuilder stderr)
        This is for unit testing

      • killJob

        public boolean killJob​(java.lang.String jobIdFile)
        Cancel the Slurm job by reading the jobid from the jobIdFile. Uses scancel command to cancel the job. The file contains a single line with the job id. This file is written by the slurm job script after the job is allocated.
        Parameters:
        jobIdFile - the jobId file
        Returns:
        true if the job is cancelled successfully

      • readFromFile

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> readFromFile​(java.lang.String filename)
        Read all the data from a text file line by line For now lets keep this util function here. We need to move it to a util location
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file
        Returns:
        string list containing the lines of the file, if failed to read, return an empty list
